channel.title: Port forwarding not working
channel.description:
IF ANYONE CALLS THIS SPOON FEEDING ILL BE PISSED
anyways i dont understand why evertime i check if my ports working it says it can ping my router but port is not reachable http://portforward.com/english/routers/port_forwarding/Actiontec/V1000H/Runescape_Private_Server.htm thats the guide i use and i do exactly what it says but it dosnt work ive had problems with this for months and i need help i got a firewall exception and i just dont understand whats wrong

item.title: Port forwarding not working
item.dc:creator: @5doomslayer4 5doomslayer4
item.description:
@5doomslayer4 wrote:

thank you its working now

Read full topic

item.title: Port forwarding not working
item.dc:creator: @smokin_flax smokin flax
item.description:
@smokin_flax wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:7, topic:389038”][quote author=smokin flax link=topic=484855.msg3553163#msg3553163 date=1301688332]

Good god.

  1. dont use portforward.com
    ill explain how to portforward for you right now.

  2. register on no-ip and make your domain address.

  3. open CMD and type: ipconfig
    2.1. Get your default gateway and enter it in your internet browser.

  4. Go to Firewall>Virtual Servers> pass should either be: admin or blank.

Enable Description Inbound port Type Private IP address Private port
check 43594 ~ 43594 (look on CMD for private IP) 43594

Then go to “Client IP Filters”
And fill out that

FINAL STEP.

Go to control panel>windows firewall>center tab>add new port>fill out
done

now you connect to 127.0.0.1
while everyone else play’s on no-ip

Not everybody has Linksys or, Belkin
[/quote]He can’t write a tutorial for every router; OP just needs to use a little common sense.[/quote]
True, though he should have asked the OP; what router he is using and what type of computer IE: Vista, XP, Win7. Then he could have tried to give a more accurate reply.

Read full topic

item.title: Port forwarding not working
item.dc:creator: @P_A_N_I_C P A N I C
item.description:
@P_A_N_I_C wrote:

[quote=“smokin flax, post:6, topic:389038”][quote author=P A N I C link=topic=484855.msg3553167#msg3553167 date=1301688396]

Good god.

  1. dont use portforward.com
    ill explain how to portforward for you right now.

  2. register on no-ip and make your domain address.

  3. open CMD and type: ipconfig
    2.1. Get your default gateway and enter it in your internet browser.

  4. Go to Firewall>Virtual Servers> pass should either be: admin or blank.

Enable Description Inbound port Type Private IP address Private port
check 43594 ~ 43594 (look on CMD for private IP) 43594

Then go to “Client IP Filters”
And fill out that

FINAL STEP.

Go to control panel>windows firewall>center tab>add new port>fill out
done

now you connect to 127.0.0.1
while everyone else play’s on no-ip

Not everybody has Linksys or, Belkin

Forgot to mention.

Well hope im write ;D
[/quote]
And, linksys & Belkin don’t have "Client IP Filters, what router are you using? & [quote]Go to control panel>windows firewall>center tab>add new port>fill out
done
[/quote] i don’t have this neither do people on Win7 like me.[/quote]

I was referring to windows XP
I got win7 atm too.

Read full topic
